title: Belly dance
summary: Belly dance (Egyptian Arabic: رقص بلدى [ɾɑʔs bælædi], translated: Dance of the Country/Folk Dance, romanized: Raks/Raas Baladi) is a dance that has its origins in Egypt.[1][2] It features movements of the hips and torso.[3] It has evolved to take many different forms depending on the country and region, both in costume and dance style; with the Egyptian styles and costumes being the most recognized worldwide due to Egyptian cinema. The Egyptian style with its traditional Egyptian rhymes is popular worldwide with many schools around the globe now practicing it.
